_.special: old uniform issued by the courier brigade

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: An {@item Explorer's Pack|PHB}, {@item cobbler's tools|PHB}, {@item climber's kit|PHB}, {@item hooded lantern|PHB}, {@item lock|PHB}, an old uniform issued by the courier brigade, and 11 gold flowers.

entries: You were a cadet with the noble Courier Brigade, where you trained at arms, learned to traverse the landscape quickly and quietly, and practiced the hallowed task of properly delivering a package. The couriers' code—"Deliverance through delivery"—taught you that your purpose is to be of service to others, and that one of the highest virtues is seeing things through to the end. For more on the Courier Brigade, see page 17.

entries.name: Feature: Pocket Map
entries: You have an old worn out pocket map of the island from your time as a cadet. The map is inscribed with a handful of paths known only to the Courier Brigade.

background.name: Mechanic

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: You gain proficiency in three {@item Artisan's Tools|PHB} of your choice.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: An {@item abacus|PHB}, ball bearings (1000), {@item block and tackle|PHB}, {@item flask|PHB} of oil, an unfinished mechanical {@item trinket|PHB}, and 15 gold flowers.

entries: You've spent most of your life working on mechanisms and machines. For you, understanding both new and old technology requires a more hands on approach. Through trial and error, you have learned to create, repair, and modify all things mechanical and electronic, and you have honed your eye to recognize useful parts among the scattered bits of technology that are found throughout the island.

entries.name: Feature: Machine Whisperer
entries: You have a knack for machines and can tell what state one is in by spending a few minutes with it. Machines that have been sundered are unusable and should be scrapped for parts. Machines in disrepair could potentially function again if someone fixed them up, and functioning machines do just that. Function!

background.name: Spirit Kin

_.special: different {@filter common ingredients|items|source=O:TTG|rarity=common|type=ingredient} (linked to your spirit allies)
special item gifted to you by a spirit

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item bedroll|PHB}, 10 {@item candle|PHB|candles}, two different {@filter common ingredients|items|source=O:TTG|rarity=common|type=ingredient} (linked to your spirit allies), a special item gifted to you by a spirit, and 10 gold flowers.

entries: Though everyone living on Obojima comes in contact with spirits to one degree or another, your interaction with the Spirit Realm has always occurred with peculiar regularity. All your life you've had a special kinship with spirits that few share in. You've come to love their food, their culture, and their people more than the average material being. These habits have drawn fascination, suspicion, and confusion from locals, but that doesn't stop them from enlisting your talents when spirit stuff gets weird.

entries.name: Feature: Connections Beyond Material
entries: You have come to know two spirits by name, and through your relationship have learned special rituals and techniques that allow you to find them across the Physical and Spirit Realms.

By using two unique ingredients that you choose when taking this background, you can contact these spirits from any distance or plane of existence. The ritual you enact to utilize these ingredients and contact a spirit is uniquely your own—it might involve a tea ceremony, or perhaps the burning of the ingredients and partaking in the aromatic smoke they produce.

language.name: Torum
entries: Torum is the favored language of the Spirit Realm. Though non-spirits can learn to understand it, beings of the Physical Realm often can't make the layered sounds required to voice the words.

language.name: Archaic First Age Languages
entries: The objects and structures from the island's earliest age contain a variety of written languages known to the islanders as First Age languages. Other than the academics who devote themselves to studying these mysterious languages, people generally know only a handful of words.

language.name: Naku Naku
entries: Most Nakudama continue to speak their original language as well as the common tongue, and they claim theirs is far richer for the telling of tales.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the spirit is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the spirit move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the spirit isn't an object.

trait.name: New Form (1/Day)
entries: When the spirit is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can choose a different object it can see within 10 feet of it and send its consciousness into that object. After it does so, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Reach
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Mage Hand} cantrip. When it does so, the spectral hand created by the spell is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the spirit is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the spirit move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the spirit isn't an object.

trait.name: New Form (2/Day)
entries: When the spirit is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can choose a different object it can see within 10 feet of it and send its consciousness into that object. After it does so, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Reach
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Mage Hand} cantrip. When it does so, the spectral hand created by the spell is {@condition invisible}.

action.name: Bite, Pinch, or Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bubble Lift (1/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Bubble Lift|ObojimaTallGrass} spell, using Wisdom as its spellcasting ability

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite, Pinch, or Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bubble Lift (1/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Bubble Lift|ObojimaTallGrass} spell, using Wisdom as its spellcasting ability.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes two attacks.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes three attacks: two with its chomp and one with its scratch.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

entries: The spirit can choose to grant itself advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes two scratch attacks.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) damage of the type associated with the spirit.

action.name: Duplicate (1/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Duplicate|ObojimaTallGrass} spell (spell save {@dc 10}), using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability, requiring no material components

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes two smack attacks.

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) damage of the type associated with the spirit.

action.name: Duplicate (2/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Duplicate|ObojimaTallGrass} spell (spell save {@dc 11}), using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spiritual Sight
entries: The spirit can see 60 feet into the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) when it is on the Physical Realm, and vice versa.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) necrotic damage. Etherealness. The spirit enters the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) from the Physical Realm, or vice versa. It is visible on the Physical Realm while it is in the Spirit Realm, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The spirit enters the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) from the Physical Realm, or vice versa. It is visible on the Physical Realm while it is in the Spirit Realm, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Incorporeal Transfer
entries: While holding an item, the spirit can cause it to become incorporeal, allowing it to pass through other objects and creatures. If the spirit lets go of the item while inside of an object or creature, the item is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space outside of the object or creature.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spiritual Sight
entries: The spirit can see 60 feet into the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) when it is on the Physical Realm, and vice versa.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The spirit enters the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) from the Physical Realm, or vice versa. It is visible on the Physical Realm while it is in the Spirit Realm, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Incorporeal Transfer
entries: While holding an item, the spirit can cause it to become incorporeal, allowing it to pass through other objects and creatures. If the spirit lets go of the item while inside of an object or creature, the item is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space outside of the object or creature.

action.name: Invisibility (1/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Invisibility} spell on itself, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability, requiring no material components.

action.name: Sleep (1/Day)
entries: The spirit casts the {@spell Sleep} spell, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability, requiring no material components.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). The spirit can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Body Bite (1/Day)
entries: While the spirit has at least 5 hit points, a friendly creature can use a bonus action to take a bite out of the spirit. The spirit takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage, and the creature regains a number of hit points equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The spirit regains 2 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Push
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). The spirit can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Body Bite (1/Day)
entries: While the spirit has at least 10 hit points, a friendly creature can use a bonus action to take a bite out of the spirit. The spirit takes {@damage 3d4} piercing damage, and the creature regains a number of hit points equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The spirit regains 4 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Push
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Great Heights
entries: When the Acorn Crab falls from a height of 10 feet or higher, it can make a Slam attack at the end of the fall. When it does so, it takes no falling damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Acorn Crab makes two Pinch attacks.

action.name: Pinch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage for every 10 feet the acorn crab

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Akaobata can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The Akaobata can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Cursed Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) psychic damage, and it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target's emotions are overwhelmed with fear, hate, sorrow, confusion, or regret. When a creature fails this saving throw, the Akaobata becomes emboldened until the end of the turn, gaining access to its bonus action options.

bonus.name: The following bonus actions can only be taken by the Akaobata while it is emboldened
Fleeting Strengths
entries: The Akaobata chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed by the Akaobata's intrusive magics. This magical curse causes the target to lose proficiency in one saving throw or skill of the Akaobata's choice. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell Remove Curse} spell or similar magic.

bonus.name: Levitate
entries: The Akaobata casts {@spell Mass Levitate|ObojimaTallGrass} (save {@dc 16}), requiring no material components. Its spellcasting ability for this spell is Charisma.

bonus.name: Power of Whispers
entries: The Akaobata chooses up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) psychic damage and become {@condition Restrained} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Aquatic Memory
entries: The Bearracuda can move under and through heavy snow as if it weren't {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. While moving through snow, the Bearracuda has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Pacifying Light
entries: If the Bearracuda becomes {@condition Blinded} by a light-based effect, it must also succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition Unconscious} for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Drag
entries: When the Bearracuda successfully grapples a creature that is its size of smaller, it moves up to its speed, carrying the {@condition Grappled} creature with it.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Cat of Prodigious Size has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Light on Its Feet
entries: When the Cat of Prodigious Size falls and isn't {@condition Incapacitated}, it can subtract up to 200 feet from the fall when calculating falling damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Cat of Prodigious Size makes two attacks: one with its Chomp and one with its Paw.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition Grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition Restrained}, and the Cat of Prodigious Size can't bite another target.

action.name: Paw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Leaping Strike
entries: The Cat of Prodigious Size pulls its body low to the ground before leaping vertically 90 feet into the air. While in the air, the Cat of Prodigious Size can make a Paw attack before slamming back down to the ground. Each creature within 20 feet of the Cat of Prodigious Size when it lands must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition Prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Clone of Viota's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Clone of Viota can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Lessons Learned
entries: If any Clone of Viota has fought a creature before, the current Clone of Viota can choose at the start of combat to either have advantage on all attack rolls made against that creature or advantage on saving throws against effects created by that creature.

trait.name: Shared Experience
entries: Any Clone of Viota can spend 1 minute to perfectly recall an experience that one of her other clones had. This is true even if that clone has been killed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Clone of Viota makes two Spectral Pass attacks.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage.

trait.name: Endless Resource
entries: If the Corrupted Muk is standing in a pool of Corruption or is connected to the greater Corruption in some way, it regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn; its Persistent Disease trait also automatically activates immediately after the Corrupted Muk dies.

trait.name: Persistent Disease
entries: There is a 15 percent chance that 1 week after a Corrupted Muk is killed, a new Corrupted Muk materializes in the location where the previous one died.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hypnotic
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Crawler must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must use all of its movement to get as close to the Crawler as possible.

trait.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: The Crawler has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swamp or wetland terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Crawler makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must also make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target loses its memory of the last 24 hours. The target regains these memories if it is targeted by the {@spell Greater Restoration} spell.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Heat Consumption
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Cuddle Bug gains 1 Freeze Point, affecting the creature as detailed below. (The effects of Freeze Points stack.)

rows: The creature has a -2 penalty to all attack rolls.
The creature can't add its proficiency bonus to any Dexterity checks or Dexterity saving throws.
The creature suffers one level of Exhaustion. This level of Exhaustion goes away when the creature no longer has any Freeze Points.
The creature's speed is halved, and it can use either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both
At the start of each of the creature's turns while it's not unconscious, it takes 5 cold damages.

entries: A creature can remove all accumulated Freeze Points by taking at least 1 fire damage or finishing a short or long rest.

action.name: Drain Heat
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) cold damage, and the Cuddle Bug regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Illusionary Lure
entries: The Deep Angler can create an image of an object, effect, or creature, which surrounds its lure, causing the chosen effect to look as if it were floating in space. The image can't create sound or smell, and physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Deep Angler makes two attacks: one with its Chomp and one with its Lure.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Large or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Deep Angler, and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the Deep Angler's turns.

The Deep Angler can hold up to 3 creatures in its mouth at a time. If the Deep Angler takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Deep Angler must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which enters an empty space within 10 feet of the Deep Angler. If the Deep Angler dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement.

action.name: Lure
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Blinded} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Intrusive Thoughts
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Demon must succeed on a {@dc 11} Intelligence saving throw or allow the Demon's magic to influence its mind until the end of its next turn. A creature under this effect takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage whenever it is hit by the Demon's Chomp attack.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Demon makes two attacks: one with its Chomp and one with its Spectral Pass.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Resting Protections
entries: While the Dragon is {@condition Unconscious}, it can't become affected or detected by spells of 3rd level or lower.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Draconic Charm
entries: One Humanoid the Dragon can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition Charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition Charmed} target obeys the Dragon's spoken commands.

If the target suffers any harm from the Dragon or another creature or receives a harmful command from the Dragon, the charm ends. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this Dragon's Draconic Charm for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Dragon Frog
languages: understands Common and Naku Naku but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Removal
entries: When a creature or object becomes enclosed within the Dragon Frog's mouth, any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Dragon Frog's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or with-out a running start.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pulling Tounge
entries: The Dragon Frog lashes out its tongue at a Medium or smaller creature or object it can see within 25 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the Dragon Frog, unless it succeeds on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. If the target is an object, it falls to the ground at the Dragon Frog's feet; if the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature must succeed on a contested Strength check or have the object pulled away from it.

legendary.name: Quick Attack
entries: Immediately after the Dragon Frog pulls a creature with its Pulling Tongue, it makes a Chomp attack against it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Dragon Frog fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Removal
entries: When a creature or object becomes enclosed within the Dragon Frog's mouth, any spell of 6th level or lower on the target ends.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Dragon Frog's long jump is up to 90 feet and its high jump is up to 45 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Multiattack
entries: The Dragon Frog makes three attacks: one with its Chomp and two with its Claws.

trait.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Large or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Dragon Frog, and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the Dragon Frog's turns.

The Dragon Frog can hold up to three creatures in its mouth at a time. If the Dragon Frog takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Dragon Frog must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which enters an empty space within 10 feet of the Dragon Frog. If the Dragon Frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition Restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement.

trait.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Croak {@recharge 5}
entries: The Dragon Frog lets out a ground-shaking croak that warps the environment in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 66 ({@damage 12d10}) thunder damage and is pushed 15 feet away from the Dragon Frog. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.
If the Dragon Frog has any creatures in its mouth when it uses its Croak, they all fall {@condition Prone} in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the Dragon Frog.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The Dragon Frog makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The Dragon Frog leaps into the air before slamming back down to the ground. Each creature within 30 feet of the Dragon Frog when it lands must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition Prone}.

legendary.name: Pulling Tongue (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Dragon Frog lashes out its tongue at a Huge or smaller creature or object it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the Dragon Frog, unless it succeeds on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw; the Dragon Frog can then make a Chomp attack against it as part of this same action. If the target is an object, it enters the Dragon Frog's mouth; if the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature must succeed on a contested Strength check or have the object pulled away from it.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The Dust Bunny's movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dust Kick
entries: The Dust Bunny kicks up dust at a creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Incapacitated} and begin sneezing uncontrollably until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Jump
entries: The Dust Bunny disappears in a poof of dust, teleporting up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The Field Giant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Without Need
entries: The Field Giant doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Huge or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from the Field Giant.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The Fish Folk can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Lucky Fool (1/Day)
entries: When the Fish Folk would fail an ability check by rolling a 5 or lower on the die, it can choose to replace the die roll with a 12 instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Fish Folk makes two melee attacks: one with its Chomp and one with its Sword.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The Lionfish King can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 12 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Lucky Fool (2/Day)
entries: When the Lionfish King would fail an ability check or miss with an attack roll by rolling a 5 or lower on the die, he can choose to replace the die roll with a 15 instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lionfish King makes three attacks: one with his Chomp and two with his Cutlass.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poisonous Spray
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d12}) poison damage.

Whether the attack hits or misses, the target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Royal Decree
entries: The Lionfish King commands a Fish Folk that can hear him to use its reaction to make an attack against a creature that he can see.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Giant Jellyfish can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Toxins
entries: A creature that comes in physical contact with a Giant Jellyfish must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and become {@condition Stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Giant Koi can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Giant Koi makes three Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage

trait.name: Cursed Form
entries: The Goro Goro can't regain hit points, except through the use of its Delectable Flavor trait.

trait.name: Delectable Flavor
entries: The Goro Goro regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points whenever it hits a creature with its Chomp attack that is drunk or affected by its Drunken Aura.

trait.name: Drunken Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the Goro Goro that starts its turn within 20 feet of the Goro Goro must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, unless the Goro Goro is {@condition Incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is inebriated by potent fermented magic until the start of its next turn. While inebriated in this way, a creature takes a -4 penalty to all ability checks and attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Goro Goro makes two attacks: one with its Claw one with its Chomp.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Giant Sake Cup
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is trapped under the Goro Goro's giant sake cup. A trapped creature is {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the giant sake cup, and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of each of its turns.

A trapped creature or an ally within 5 feet of the giant sake cup can try to lift it with a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, ending its effects on a success. The effect also ends early if the Goro Goro makes another Giant Sake Cup attack or otherwise lifts the cup.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The Hammer Gull has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hammer Gull makes two Peck attacks.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boulder Drop
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition Prone}.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The Harpy has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Dive Bomb
entries: If the Harpy misses its attack while flying, its movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harpy makes two attacks with its Claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Battle Fury (1/Day)
entries: If a Harpy sees an ally fall {@condition unconscious} or die, it makes a Claw attack or gains 5 temporary hit points (its choice).

trait.name: Hunting Prowess
entries: If the Hill Dragon didn't make an attack on its previous turn, its speed increases by 15 feet. This benefit can stack up to three times (a maximum increase of 45 feet). Once the Hill Dragon makes an attack, its speed resets to normal.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hill Dragon makes two attacks: one with its Chomp and one with its Claw.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition Prone}.

bonus.name: Use of Terrain
entries: The Hill Dragon takes the Hide action; it can only use this bonus action if it is in a field or grassy environment.

trait.name: Sleep Deprived
entries: The Howler has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or magically put to sleep.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: When a creature misses the Howler with an attack, the Howler must release a gut curling bout of laughter, provided it has its reaction available. The next time the attacker makes an attack roll or ability check before the end of its next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.

trait.name: Lead by Example
entries: If the Howler hits a creature with its first attack on its turn, it can forgo its second attack to bolster its allies. Each friendly creature that saw the Howler make the attack gains a +2 bonus to its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Sleep Deprived
entries: The Howler has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or magically put to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Howler makes two attacks: either one with its Chomp and one with its Club, or two with its Longbow.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Regroup
entries: Each friendly creature within 20 feet of the Howler can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: When a creature misses the howler with an attack, the howler must release a gut curling bout of laughter, provided it has its reaction available. The next time the attacker makes an attack roll or ability check before the end of its next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Howler makes three attacks: one with its Chomp and two with its Shortsword. Alternatively, it makes two attacks with its Longbow.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Tricky Maneuver
entries: If the Howler hits a creature with its first Longbow attack on its turn while hidden, it can forgo its second attack to take the Hide action.

reaction.name: Paranoid
entries: The Howler can't be {@status surprised}.

reaction.name: Sleep Deprived
entries: The Howler has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or magically put to sleep.

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: When a creature misses the howler with an attack, the howler must release a gut curling bout of laughter, provided it has its reaction available. The next time the attacker makes an attack roll or ability check before the end of its next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.

monster.name: The Hunter
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Hunter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless it wishes to be affected, the Hunter is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Hunter's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When the Hunter dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

trait.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: If the Hunter drops below 250 hit points, it automatically regains 100 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hunter makes three attacks: two with its Claw and one with Peck.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: Each creature of the Hunter's choice that is within 1,000 feet of the Hunter and aware of it gains inspiration and 19 ({@dice 3d12}) temporary hit points.
Once a creature benefits from the Hunter's Inspiring Presence, it can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

legendary.name: Peck
entries: The Hunter makes a Peck attack.

legendary.name: Spiral Flight (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Hunter briefly pulls its wings in while twisting its body. Each creature on top of the Hunter must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or be thrown in a random direction 30 feet away from the Hunter. In addition, creatures flying within 30 feet of the Hunter are pushed 15 feet away from it.

legendary.name: Swallow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Hunter attempts to engulf a creature it can see within 20 feet of it. The target creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the Hunter. A swallowed creature is {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Hunter, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the Hunter's turns.

If the Hunter takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Hunter must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Hunter.
If the Hunter dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition Restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition Prone}.

legendary.name: Thunderous Beak (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Hunter hisses and clacks its enormous beak, which creates a deafening sound that can be heard for miles. Each creature, other than the Hunter, within 150 feet of the Hunter must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw; a swallowed creature automatically fails this save. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition Deafened} for 24 hours or until it is target by a {@spell Lesser Restoration} spell. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition Deafened}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Kafuka's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The Kafuka can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: Kafuka can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Summon Swarm (2/Day)
entries: If available, the Kafuka causes a group of tiny woodland animals to form a swarm and attack a creature that the Kafuka can see.
This swarm of woodland creatures uses the {@creature Swarm of Rats} stat block and immediately disperses when it takes damage

trait.name: Thorn-Covered
entries: If the Lion's Blume attempts to grapple a creature, the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage whether the grapple succeeds or not. While {@condition Grappled} by the Lion's Blume, the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Perfume Poof
entries: The mossling can cast {@spell Pacify Person|ObojimaTallGrass} at will, and its spell save DC is 11.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Gift of Flight
entries: The Pixie magically grants a creature it can see a Flying speed of 30 feet. The creature keeps its Flying speed, as long as the Pixie is holding its breath.

The Pixie can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds). The Pixie can only grant this effect to one creature at a time, and when the effect ends, it must wait 1 minute before using it again.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Postal Knight makes two melee attacks or three attacks with its Sling.

action.name: Frying Pan
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Defensive Cooking
entries: When wielding a frying pan, the Postal Knight can gain a +1 bonus to AC until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Brother in Arms
entries: If damage is dealt to a friendly creature within 5 feet of the Postal Knight, the Postal Knight and the target each take half of the damage dealt, splitting the damage between them.

monster.name: Rubble Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Collapse {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem targets a 15-foot-diameter circle within 15 feet of itself. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be crushed as the golem leaps and lands in the designated location, turning into a shockwave of rubble and transforming into its rubble form. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

While the golem is in rubble form, the area of impact is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, the golem is {@condition incapacitated} and has resistance to all damage, and it automatically fails Dexterity saving throws.
The golem returns to its original form at the start of its next turn, shunting any creature in its space to another unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Entangling Form
entries: A creature that touches the Seaweed Elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or become {@condition Restrained} by the elemental. At the start of each of the {@condition Restrained} creature's turns, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage as the tendrils of seaweed squeeze it. The {@condition Restrained} creature can spend its action to attempt the saving throw again, ending the effect on a success. If the elemental moves more than 10 feet away from the {@condition Restrained} creature, the effect ends.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the Seaweed Elemental is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the Seaweed Elemental move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the Seaweed Elemental isn't ordinary seaweed.

trait.name: Mostly Clumps
entries: The Seaweed Elemental can move through a space as narrow as 5 inches wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Rush
entries: If the sheep dragon moves at least 20 feet in a straight line, during which it moves within 5 feet of a creature and flies past it, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pulled 10 feet in the direction the sheep dragon is moving and knocked {@condition prone}, and the sheep dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack from it. On a successful save, the creature isn't pulled or knocked {@condition prone}, and if it makes an opportunity attack against the sheep dragon, it does so with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sheep dragon makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Headbutt. Alternatively, it makes three Wind Pistol attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wind Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Shrapnel
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of the swarm hits it with a melee attack while the swarm isn't underwater, the creature must make a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw as bits of tiny bones pelt it. On a failed save, the creature flinches, giving it disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes this turn.

trait.name: Skeletonized
entries: The swarm doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny fish. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.name: Sky King
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Cloud Trail
entries: Wherever the Sky King flies, it creates a trail of giant fluffy white clouds in its wake.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Sky King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless it wishes to be affected, the Sky King is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Sky King's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When the Sky King dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

trait.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: If the Sky King drops below 150 hit points, a giant storm begins to brew above and the oceans begin to become uneasy. For the next minute, creatures that touch the Sky King or hit it with a melee attack take 9 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sky King makes three attacks: two with its Chomp and one with its Tail.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: Each creature of the Sky King's choice that is within 300 feet of the Sky King and aware of it gains inspiration and a flying speed of 30 feet for the next minute. Once a creature benefits from the Sky King's Inspiring Presence, it can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

legendary.name: Chomp
entries: The Sky King makes a Chomp attack.

legendary.name: Turbulent Shift (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The air or water surrounding the Sky King begins to spin violently.

Each creature, other than the Sky King, within 60 feet of the Sky King must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 ({@dice 8d6}) bludgeoning and is disoriented until the end of its next turn. A disoriented creature makes all ability checks and saving throws with disadvantage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't disoriented. Objects and structures in the area automatically take maximum damage from this effect.

legendary.name: Nullify (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The effects of all spells of 3rd level or lower within 120 feet of the Sky King are suspended (as if by the {@spell Antimagic Field} spell) until the start of the Sky King's next turn, at which point their magic returns.

monster.name: Jumaga The Sky Salamander
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Color Shift
entries: Jumaga naturally changes color to blend into its environment, giving it advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide from creatures that are more than 300 feet away from it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Jumaga fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Jumaga's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When Jumaga dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

trait.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: If Jumaga drops below 200 hit points, its color turns a bright orange for 1 minute. For the duration, its Chomp attack deals an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage on a hit, and it regains 5 ({@dice 1d10}) hit points each time it's targeted by a spell of 3rd level or lower.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jumaga makes three attacks: two with its Chomp and one with its Tail.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5-6). Jumaga exhales its paralyzing breath in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Jumaga makes a Tail attack.

legendary.name: Skin Toxins (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Jumaga's body excretes a dangerous toxin. Until the start of Jumaga's next turn, creatures that touch it or hit it with a melee attack take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Bestial Hiss (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Jumaga produces a thunderous hiss which terrifies creatures around it. Each creature within 150 feet of Jumaga must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass} until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Heat Wave
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the Slagger takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage. If the creature is wearing metal armor or wielding metal weapons, the damage is doubled.

trait.name: Scorch
entries: Flammable objects ignite if they come within 15 feet of the Slagger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Slagger uses its Cough. It then makes one Slam attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spew Magma {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., three targets. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) fire damage. Regardless of whether the attacks hit or miss, the area within 5 feet of each target is covered in lava. The lava is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and a creature that starts its turn in the lava takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) fire damage. The lava cools and hardens after 1 minute, at which point it becomes harmless and is no longer {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Cough
entries: The Slagger coughs a sulfurous cloud in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The green slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Flee
entries: To save itself from danger, the green slime can sever off a part of its body to cause a distraction. The slime chooses to lose any number of hit points when using this ability. For each hit point lost, a tiny copy of the slime leaps from its body and moves 30 feet in a random direction, after which it falls lifeless.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Yellow Slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Horrid Stench
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 20 feet of the Yellow Slime, it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be gagged by the terrible smell of the slime. On a failed save, the creature must use all of its movement to move away from the slime by the safest available route.

trait.name: Sticky
entries: If the Yellow Slime doesn't move for a round, the space that it occupies becomes slathered in a sticky, acrid yellow coating. For all creatures except Oozes, the space is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and when the creature enters the space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Yellow Slime makes one Spike attack and uses its Arrange.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Arrange
entries: The Yellow Slime attempts to pull a creature within 5 feet of it through its body and into another space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage and be moved to an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the slime.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Orange Slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Explosive
entries: If the Orange Slime takes fire damage, a portion of its body explodes. Each creature within 10 feet of the slime must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to the amount dealt to the slime on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Steaming
entries: If water touches the Orange Slime, a burning hot wave of steam erupts from it, filling the area within 20 feet of the slime. The area is heavily obscured until the end of the slime's next turn or until a strong wind disperses it. This steam doesn't impede the vision of Orange and {@creature Yellow Slime|ObojimaTallGrass|Yellow Slimes}.

trait.name: Sulfurous Haze
entries: Creatures within 60 feet of the slime take a -5 penalty to ranged attack rolls against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Orange Slime makes two Spike attacks and uses its Arrange.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@dice 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Arrange
entries: The Orange Slime attempts to pull a creature within 10 feet of it through its body and into another space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage and be moved to an unoccupied space within 15 feet of the slime.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The corrupted slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Sickness
entries: Each time a creature comes in contact with the corrupted slime, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Once a creature has been affected by a corrupted slime's Sickness, it is immune for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Drain
entries: The corrupted slime deals 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage to each creature affected by its sickness within 120 feet of it. It then regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snowball spirits make two pelt attacks.

action.name: Pelt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is at least one size smaller than the snowball spirits, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be whelmed by the snowball spirits. A whelmed creature is considered {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and is carried with the snowball spirits when they move. A creature within 5 feet of the spirits can pull a whelmed creature out of them by taking an action to make a {@dc 14} Strength check, freeing the creature on a success.
The snowball spirit can have no more than one creature whelmed at a time, unless it reaches the Huge size, at which point it can whelm up to three creatures at a time.

action.name: Snowball
entries: Whenever the snowball spirits take the {@action Dash} action, they can make a slam attack as part of that action. Alternatively, if they are in snowy terrain, they can choose to absorb the snow during the movement, growing by one size and regaining 10 hit points.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the soda slime is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the soda slime move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the soda slime isn't an ordinary soda can.

trait.name: Soda Pop
entries: When a soda slime is reduced to 0 hit points, each creature within 10 feet of the soda slime must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) force damage as it explodes in a fizzy pop.

trait.name: Sticky Nature
entries: The soda slime can occupy the same space as another creature. While in the same space as the soda slime, a creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity checks. When a creature leaves the soda slime's space, it must first make a {@dc 10} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, carrying the slime with it on a failure.

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Sticky Tendril
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from the soda slime, it forces the provoking creature to make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, causing it to fall {@condition prone} on a failed save.

walk.condition: (0 ft., Flying 30 ft. in flying form)

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Here is a list of abilities a Spirit can have
entries: Some of these abilities may have an impact on the Spirit's Challenge Rating.

items.name: Commune with Animals
entries: The Spirit can communicate with beasts as if they shared a language.

items.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The Spirit can see 60 feet into the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) when it is on the Physical Realm, and vice versa.

items.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

items.name: Invisible
entries: The Spirit is always {@condition Invisible}.

items.name: Magical
entries: The Spirit knows two cantrips and one 1st-level spell, which it can cast at will.

items.name: Ocular Prowess
entries: The Spirit has {@sense Truesight} out to a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Shift
entries: The Spirit can enter the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) from the Physical Realm, or vice versa.

items.name: Action: Spectral Pass
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 ({@damage 4d8}) force or necrotic damage.

trait.name: Promising Threat
entries: The bestial spirit has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks if the target has seen it hit a creature with its Chomp attack in the past minute.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Devour
entries: When the bestial spirit reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it consumes some of the creature's essence, regaining {@dice 1d10} hit points.

walk.condition: (0 ft., Flying 20 ft. in flying form)

trait.name: Distracting Maneuver
entries: When the Pest Spirit takes the Dash action, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Hard to Catch
entries: The Pest Spirit has advantage on ability checks and saving throws against grapples and other effects that would impede its movement.

action.name: Frustration
entries: The Pest Spirit interacts with a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or the spirit gains inspiration.

trait.name: Earth Aquatic
entries: The stone whale can move through stone and earth as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The stone whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The stone whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The stone whale has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hallucinatory Chatter
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the Stul and can hear it, the Stul can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw if the Stul isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for 1 minute.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect ends early for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Beckon
entries: The Stul commands any number of creatures {@condition charmed} by its Hallucinatory Chatter to approach it. Each creature must spend its action on its next turn to move as close to the Stul as it can.

action.name: Mental Invasion
entries: One creature the Stul chooses that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be forced to use its reaction to move its full speed in the opposite direction of the Stul.

trait.name: Severed Body
entries: Urugama has four spectral bodies, each of which Urugama can take actions from. These different bodies can't move more than 100 feet away from each other, and Urugama divides its movement among its four bodies as it chooses.

trait.name: Shifting Form
entries: At the start of Urugama's turn, one of its bodies is randomly selected as the true Urugama.
Only the true body can take damage or suffer effects that round. The other bodies can still be targeted with attacks and effects, but they are unaffected and pass through the bodies without harm.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Two of Urugama's forms make a spectral pass attack.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Haunting Chuckle
entries: If at least three of Urugama's bodies are within 20 feet of each other, they can release a haunting chuckle. All creatures within 30 feet of an Urugama body that can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a failed save, the creature is immune to Urugama's Haunting Chuckle for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Vespoma makes two attacks: one with its chomp and one with its claws.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Master's Voice
entries: The Vespoma can cast the {@spell Command} spell at will, using Charisma as its spellcasting ability.
This spell has a save DC of 12, and it increases by 1 for each Wanderers and merchantsespoma within 30 feet of it (to a maximum of 20).

trait.name: Flammable
entries: The Vile Corruption is considered flammable and ignites as if it were a flammable object. If the Vile Corruption takes more than 35 fire damage from a single attack or effect, or if it is on fire for 3 or more rounds, it explodes in a black ball of flames. Each creature within 20 feet of the Vile Corruption when it explodes must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage of a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Vile Corruption has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Vile Corruption can change its shape to match that of any beast, demon, elemental, monstrosity, or spirit at will. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. While in this form the Vile Corruption still keeps its watery appearance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Vile Corruption makes three attacks: one with its bestial bite and two with its claw mimicry.

action.name: Bestial Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or have putrid water forced down its throat. On a failed save, the water enters the creature's stomach and nullifies any potions currently affecting it.

action.name: Claw Mimicry
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Avian Mimicry
entries: Waterlogged copies of songbirds burst from the Vile Corruption and soar toward up to 3 creatures that are within 30 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Wandering Door
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Dispel Susceptibility
entries: The Wandering Door becomes a mundane pile of rubble if it's targeted by a {@spell Dispel Magic} spell of 7th level or higher.

trait.name: Doorway
entries: A creature that enters the Wandering Door can teleport to any doorway on any plane as if the doorway was planted directly in front of the location.
If a creature is not aware of how the door's magic works, it is instead teleported to a random doorway.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Wandering Door is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (7/Day)
entries: If the Wandering Door fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The Wandering Door's movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Wandering Door has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Feet
entries: The Wandering Door can walk on all surfaces, including vertically up walls and on top of water.

action.name: Leap!
entries: The Wandering Door leaps 60 feet vertically into the air.

action.name: Shake!
entries: The Wandering Door shakes violently. All creatures on top of the Wandering Door must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be thrown away from the door, landing {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it.

reaction.name: Flee
entries: If a creature moves within 30 feet of the Wandering Door, it moves up to 100 feet.

reaction.name: Shake!
entries: When a creature lands on top of the Wandering Door, the door shakes violently. All creatures on top of the Wandering Door must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be thrown away from the door, landing {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the Watchwood Tree is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the Watchwood Tree move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the Watchwood Tree isn't an ordinary tree.

trait.name: Unruly Earth
entries: The ground within a 15-foot radius centered on the Watchwood Tree is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for all creatures besides the Watchwood Tree.

action.name: Root Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Watching Eye {@recharge}
entries: The terrifying gaze of a Watchwood Tree can leave a creature frozen in its tracks. Each creature of the Watchwood Tree's choice within a 15-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition restrained}; a creature that can't be {@condition frightened} automatically succeeds on its saving throw. The Watchwood Tree can then immediately make a Root Slam attack against each creature that failed its saving throw.
A creature {@condition restrained} in this way can use its action to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom check, freeing itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The witch has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Coven Member
entries: The witch has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks involving a witch coven.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Drum Line
entries: If the Yokario makes an attack against a creature that has been hit by one of its allies' Drum Mallets since the end of the Yokario's last turn, its Drum Mallet has an attack bonus of +6 instead of +4.

action.name: Drum Mallet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.)

trait.name: Bioluminescent Glow
entries: The Giant Bora Bug emits a soft light from its spiked wing casing, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius around it.

action.name: Horn Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike Flurry {@recharge 5}
entries: The Giant Bora Bug releases a flurry of spikes. Each creature within 10 feet of the Giant Bora Bug must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Innate Spellcasting. The Pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: {@spell Druidcraft|PHB}, {@spell Jolt|ObojimaTallGrass}, {@spell Root Grab|ObojimaTallGrass}, {@spell Transparency|ObojimaTallGrass}

1/day each: {@spell Confusion|PHB}, {@spell Control Animal|ObojimaTallGrass}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|PHB}, {@spell Entangle|PHB}, {@spell Obscure Object|ObojimaTallGrass}, {@spell Pacify Person|ObojimaTallGrass}, {@spell Sleep|PHB}, {@spell Whelm Weapon|ObojimaTallGrass}

trait.name: Gift of Flight
entries: The Pixie magically grants a creature it can see a Flying speed of 30 feet. The creature keeps its Flying speed, as long as the Pixie is holding its breath. The Pixie can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds). The Pixie can only grant this effect to one creature at a time, and when the effect ends, it must wait 1 minute before using it again.

action.name: Snap Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is also {@condition Grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) as the Venus Fly Rat clamps down with its powerful jaws. While {@condition Grappled} in this way, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Tail Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. Pollen Burst (Recharge 5-6). The Venus Fly Rat releases a burst of pollen in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the {@spell Confusion} spell for 1 minute.
